00040 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00041 // min max macros
00042 #define MIN(x, y)       ((x)<(y))? (x) : (y)
00043 #define MAX(x, y)       ((x)>(y))? (x) : (y)

00045 
00046   /**
00047   * @brief get the probe quartet given the allele type and match type
00048   * @param allele - allele type: A or B
00049   * @param matchtype - the match type: perfect or mis
00050   * @return the probe index
00051   */
00052 int CQuartet::GetIndex(const int& allele, const int& matchtype)
00053   {
00054     if(allele == A_Allele && matchtype == PM) return 0;
00055     else if(allele == A_Allele && matchtype == MM) return 1;
00056     else if(allele == B_Allele && matchtype == PM) return 2;
00057     else if(allele == B_Allele && matchtype == MM) return 3;
00058     else return -1; // should never be here
00059   }
00060 
00061   /**
00062   * @brief default constructor
00063   */
00064 CQuartet::CQuartet()
00065   {
00066     memset(pixels, 1, sizeof(int)*NUMCELLS);
00067     memset(intensity, 0, sizeof(float)*NUMCELLS);
00068     memset(variance, 0, sizeof(float)*NUMCELLS);
00069   }

00071 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00072 // function for convenience
00073 /**
00074 * @brief converting function between model and state
00075 * @param model - model index
00076 * @return the state the model is mapped to
00077 */
00078 int GetState(const int& model) 
00079 {
00080         if(model == 0) return 1;
00081         else if(model == 1) return 5;
00082         else if(model == 2) return 4;
00083         else return 0;
00084 }
00085 
00086 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00087 // function for convenience
00088 /**
00089 * @brief A simple utility function
00090 * 
00091 * @param mu - observed mean
00092 * @param var - variance
00093 * @param estmu - estimated mean
00094 * @return the omega value
00095 */
00096 double Omega(const double& mu, const double& var, const double& estmu)
00097 {       
00098         return (var + (mu - estmu)*(mu - estmu));
00099 }
00100 
00101 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00102 // calculate the estimated means
00103 /**
00104 * @brief calculate the mean for a given model
00105 * @param quartet - the probe quartet
00106 * @param model - the current model
00107 * @param mu - the mean to be returned
00108 * @return void
00109 */
00110 void CalcMu(const CQuartet &quartet, const int& model, double mu[])
00111 {
00112         double bgNum = 0, bgDen = 0, fgNum = 0, fgDen = 0, bgmu = 0, fgmu = 0;
00113         int state = GetState(model), idx = 0;
00114         for(idx = 0; idx < NUMCELLS; idx++) 
00115         {       
00116                 if(!(state & (1 << idx)))
00117                 { 
00118                         bgNum += quartet.pixels[idx]*quartet.intensity[idx];
00119                         bgDen += quartet.pixels[idx];
00120                 }
00121                 else 
00122                 { 
00123                         fgNum += quartet.pixels[idx] * quartet.intensity[idx];
00124                         fgDen += quartet.pixels[idx];
00125                 }
00126         }
00127 
00128         // Calculate estimated intensities
00129         if(bgDen > 0) bgmu = bgNum/bgDen;
00130         if(fgDen>0) fgmu = fgNum/fgDen;
00131 
00132         for(idx = 0; idx < NUMCELLS; idx++) 
00133         {       
00134                 if(!(state & (1 << idx)))
00135                 {
00136                         mu[idx] = bgmu;
00137                 }
00138                 else 
00139                 {
00140                         mu[idx] = fgmu;
00141                 }
00142         }
00143 }
00144 
00145 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00146 // calculate the estimated variances
00147 /**
00148 * @brief calculate the sigma for a given model with given means
00149 * @param quartet - the probe quartet
00150 * @param model - the current model
00151 * @param mu - the mean to this model
00152 * @param sigma - the sigmas to be returned
00153 * @return void
00154 */
00155 void CalcSigma(const CQuartet &quartet, double mu[], double sigma[], const int& model)
00156 {
00157         double omega = 0, bgNum = 0, bgDen = 0, fgNum = 0, fgDen = 0, bgParm,fgParm = 0;
00158         int state = GetState(model), ib = 0;
00159         for(ib = 0; ib < NUMCELLS; ib ++) 
00160         {       
00161                 if(!(state & (1 << ib)))
00162                 { 
00163                         omega = Omega(quartet.intensity[ib],quartet.variance[ib],mu[ib]);
00164                         bgNum += quartet.pixels[ib]*omega;
00165                         bgDen += quartet.pixels[ib];
00166                 }
00167                 else 
00168                 { 
00169                         omega = Omega(quartet.intensity[ib],quartet.variance[ib],mu[ib]);
00170                         fgNum += quartet.pixels[ib] * omega;
00171                         fgDen += quartet.pixels[ib];
00172                 }
00173         }
00174 
00175         // Calculate estimated variances        
00176         bgParm = bgNum/bgDen;
00177         if(fgDen > 0) fgParm = fgNum/fgDen;
00178         for(ib = 0; ib < NUMCELLS; ib++) 
00179         {       
00180                 if(!(state & ( 1 << ib)))
00181                 {
00182                         sigma[ib] = bgParm;
00183                 }
00184                 else 
00185                 {
00186                         sigma[ib] = fgParm;
00187                 }
00188         }
00189 }
00190 
00191 /** 
00192  * Round the double and return it.
00193  * @param d - The double to round.
00194  * @param iDecimalPlaces - The number of decimal places to round to.
00195  * @return - rounded double value.
00196  */ 
00197 double round(double val,int places)
00198 {
00199   double v_int,v_frac;
00200   double place_10,v_int10,v_frac10;
00201 
00202   // split into parts.
00203   v_frac=modf(val,&v_int);
00204 
00205   // create our shift
00206   place_10=pow(10.0,places);
00207   // shift the frac part up and truncate
00208   v_frac10=modf(v_frac*place_10,&v_int10);
00209   // std-c++ round says that it rounds away from zero.
00210   // apply the rounding of the last digit.
00211   if (v_frac10>=0.5) {
00212     v_int10=v_int10+1.0;
00213   }
00214   else if (v_frac10<=-0.5) {
00215     v_int10=v_int10-1.0;
00216   }
00217 
00218   // shift fract back down.
00219   v_frac=v_int10/place_10;
00220 
00221   // put back together.
00222   return (v_int+v_frac);
00223 }

00226 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00227 // calculate the loglikelihood for a quartet
00228 /**
00229 * @brief calculate loglikelihood of a probe quartet given model mean and sigma
00230 * @param quartet - the probe quartet
00231 * @param mu - the mean to the model
00232 * @param sigma - the mean to the model
00233 * @return the loglikelihood
00234 */
00235 double CalcLogLikelihood(const CQuartet& quartet, double mu [], double sigma[])
00236 {       
00237         double omega;
00238         double sum = 0;
00239 
00240         for( int ib=0; ib < NUMCELLS; ib++) 
00241         {       
00242                 if(sigma[ib]>0)
00243                 { 
00244                         omega = Omega(quartet.intensity[ib],quartet.variance[ib],mu[ib]);
00245                         omega = omega/sigma[ib];
00246                         double f = quartet.pixels[ib] * (omega + log10(sigma[ib]) + LOG2PI);
00247                         sum += round(f, 10);
00248                 }
00249         }
00250         sum *= -.5;
00251 
00252         return sum;
00253 }
00254 
00255 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00256 // calculate the loglikelihood for a quartet
00257 /**
00258 * @brief calculate loglikelihood of a probe quartet for a given model
00259 * @param quartet - the probe quartet
00260 * @param model - the model in consideration
00261 * @return the loglikelihood
00262 */
00263 float CalcLogLikelihood(const CQuartet& quartet, const int& model)
00264 {
00265         double mu[NUMCELLS], sigma[NUMCELLS], fVal;
00266         
00267         // calculate estimated mean
00268         CalcMu(quartet, model, mu);
00269 
00270         // calculate estimated variances
00271         CalcSigma(quartet, mu, sigma, model);
00272 
00273         // calculate loglikelihood
00274         fVal = CalcLogLikelihood(quartet, mu, sigma);
00275 
00276         return (float)fVal;
00277 }

00279 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00280 // check large background, true if background is greater than foreground
00281 /**
00282 * @brief check whether backgroud is higher than foreground or not for a given model
00283 *
00284 * @param quartet - the probe quartet to be checked
00285 * @param model - the model to be tested
00286 * @return true if yes, false otherwise
00287 */
00288 bool CheckLargeBackground(const CQuartet &quartet, const int& model)
00289 {
00290         float fg = 0, bg = 0;
00291 
00292         // this is the original one
00293         if(model == 0) // AA
00294         {
00295                 fg = quartet.intensity[0];
00296                 bg = MAX(MAX(quartet.intensity[1],quartet.intensity[2]),quartet.intensity[3]);
00297         }
00298         else if(model == 2) // BB
00299         {
00300                 fg = quartet.intensity[2];
00301                 bg = MAX(MAX(quartet.intensity[0],quartet.intensity[1]),quartet.intensity[3]);
00302         }
00303         else if(model == 1) // AB
00304         {
00305                 fg = MIN(quartet.intensity[0],quartet.intensity[2]);
00306                 bg = MAX(quartet.intensity[1],quartet.intensity[3]);
00307         }
00308         else return false;
00309 
00310 /*
00311         // this would be a better one in term of ballancing het and hom
00312         // may add a flag to switch the two later
00313         if(model == 0) // AA
00314         {
00315                 fg = quartet.intensity[0];
00316                 bg = (quartet.intensity[1] + quartet.intensity[2] + quartet.intensity[3])/3;
00317         }
00318         else if(model == 2) // BB
00319         {
00320                 fg = quartet.intensity[2];
00321                 bg = (quartet.intensity[0] + quartet.intensity[1] + quartet.intensity[3])/3;
00322         }
00323         else if(model == 1) // AB
00324         {
00325                 fg = 0.5*(quartet.intensity[0] + quartet.intensity[2]);
00326                 bg = 0.5*(quartet.intensity[1] + quartet.intensity[3]);
00327         }
00328         else return false;
00329 */
00330 
00331         return (bg >= fg);
00332 }
00333 
00334 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00335 // get p-value through wilcoxon signed rank test
00336 /**
00337 * Apply Wilcoxon signed rank test on the loglikelihood difference vector to compute a p-value
00338 *
00339 * @param x - the loglikelihood difference vector
00340 * @return the p-value
00341 */
00342 float GetPValue(const vector<float>& x)
00343 {
00344   //    int len = x.size();
00345 
00346         // 1. Ignore all zero differences.
00347         vector <float> newdiff = x;
00348         int n = 0, i = 0;
00349         for (i = 0; i < x.size(); ++i) 
00350         {
00351                 if (x[i] != 0.0) 
00352                 {
00353                         newdiff[n] = x[i];
00354                         n++;
00355                 }
00356         }
00357         newdiff.resize(n);
00358 
00359         // 2.  Assign integer ranks to the differences.
00360         vector <float> ranks(n);
00361         for (i=0; i<n; ++i) 
00362         {
00363                 ranks[i] = i + 1.0f;
00364         }
00365 
00366         float p_value = 1.0f;
00367         if (n == 0) // No non-zero differences.  Output 0.5 as the one-sided p-value and detection is absent.
00368                 return 0.5f;
00369         else 
00370         {
00371                 // 3. Convert differences to absolute values and sort in ascending order.
00372                 vector <pair<float,int> > absdiff(n);
00373                 for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) 
00374                 {
00375                         absdiff[i].first = fabs(newdiff[i]);
00376                         absdiff[i].second = i;
00377                 }
00378                 sort(absdiff.begin(), absdiff.end());
00379 
00380                 // 4. If there are ties among absolute differences, all differences in a tie
00381                 //    group are assigned to a rank equal to the average of the integer ranks.
00382                 int nTies = 0;  
00383                 for (i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) 
00384                 {
00385                         if (absdiff[i].first == absdiff[i+1].first) 
00386                         {
00387                                 nTies ++;
00388                                 break;
00389                         }
00390                 }
00391 
00392                 vector <float> invr(n);
00393                 for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) 
00394                 {
00395                         invr[absdiff[i].second] = ranks[i];
00396                 }
00397                 
00398                 float w = 0;
00399                 for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) 
00400                 {
00401                         if (newdiff[i] > 0)
00402                                 w += invr[i];
00403                 }
00404 
00405                 if (nTies == 0)
00406                 {
00407                         int iCode = 0;
00408                         for (i=0; i < n; ++i)
00409                         {
00410                                 if (newdiff[i] > 0)
00411                                 {
00412                                         iCode += 1 << ((int) invr[i] - 1);
00413                                 }
00414                         }
00415                         p_value = dmFGetPValue(n-1, iCode);
00416                 }
00417                 else
00418                 {
00419                         // p-value = sum(u(Sj > S) + 0.5 * u(Sj = S)) / 2 to power n
00420                         // where j = 1 to 2 to power n.
00421                         // and u(Sj > S) = 1 if Sj > S and 0 otherwise.
00422                         // and u(Sj = S) = 1 if Sj = S and 0 otherwise.
00423                         int twoToN = 1 << n;
00424                         vector<int> mask(n);
00425                         for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) 
00426                         {
00427                                 mask[i] = 1 << i;
00428                         }
00429                         vector <int> posRanks(twoToN);
00430                         for (i = 0; i < twoToN; ++i) 
00431                         {
00432                                 float sum = 0;
00433                                 for (int j = 0; j < n; ++j) 
00434                                 {
00435                                         if (i & mask[j])
00436                                                 sum += ranks[j];
00437                                 }
00438                                 posRanks[i] = (int)sum; /// @todo Why are we summing
00439                         }
00440                         float tail = 0;
00441                         for (i = 0; i < twoToN; ++i) 
00442                         {
00443                                 if (posRanks[i] > w) 
00444                                 {
00445                                         tail ++;
00446                                 }
00447                                 else if (posRanks[i] == w) 
00448                                 {
00449                                         tail += 0.5;
00450                                 }
00451                         }
00452                         p_value = tail / (float) twoToN;
00453                 }
00454         }
00455 
00456         return p_value;
00457 }
00458 
00459 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00460 // compare two pairs based only on p-values
00461 struct PairLess : public binary_function<pair<float,int>,pair<float,int>,bool>
00462 {
00463         bool operator () (const pair<float,int>& x, const pair<float,int>& y) const
00464         {
00465                 return (x.first < y.first);
00466         }
00467 };
00468 
00469 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00470 // Get DM genotype call with a p-value as confidence
00471 // Convention for models: NC-> -1, AA->0, AB->1, BB->2
00472 /**
00473 * the main entry function of DM algorithm, which starts with a vector of probe quartets and some parameters
00474 * then run through the whole DM flow, return the genotype along with a p-value associated with
00475 * 
00476 * @param vquartets - a vector of probe quartets
00477 * @param results - a result container to hold the genotype and p-values and return
00478 * @param hetMult - the heterozygote multiplier to be multiplied on AB model
00479 * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00480 */
00481 bool CallDM(const vector<CQuartet> &vquartets, pair<float,int>& results, const float& hetMult)
00482 {
00483         int nQ = vquartets.size();
00484 
00485         // no less than 1, no more than 14
00486         if(nQ <= 0 || nQ > 14) return false;
00487 
00488         // the loglikelihood matrix for all quartets
00489         vector<vector<float> > LLMatrix(nQ);
00490         int iq = 0, model = -1;
00491         for(iq = 0; iq < nQ; iq ++)
00492         {
00493                 LLMatrix[iq].resize(NUMCELLS);
00494         }
00495 
00496         // there are multiple quartets, we make call base on all of them
00497         // calculate probe quartet level loglikelihoods for all available quartets
00498         for(iq = 0; iq < nQ; iq ++)
00499         {
00500                 LLMatrix[iq][0] = CalcLogLikelihood(vquartets[iq], -1);
00501                 for(model = 1; model < 4; model ++)
00502                 {
00503                         // check large background for models other than NC
00504                         if(CheckLargeBackground(vquartets[iq], model-1))
00505                         {
00506                                 LLMatrix[iq][model] = LLMatrix[iq][0];
00507                         }
00508                         else
00509                         {
00510                                 LLMatrix[iq][model] = CalcLogLikelihood(vquartets[iq], model - 1);
00511                         }
00512                 }
00513 
00514                 // apply the het multiplier to AB model by adding the desired constant to AB loglikelihood
00515                 LLMatrix[iq][2] += hetMult;
00516         }
00517 
00518         // the loglikelihood ratio vector, prepare for SNP level aggregation
00519         vector<float> LLRatioVector(nQ);
00520         vector<pair<float,int> > PvalModelVector(4);
00521 
00522         for(model = -1; model < 3; model ++)
00523         {
00524                 for(iq = 0; iq < nQ; iq ++)
00525                 {
00526                         float fRatio = FLOATINFINITY;
00527                         for(int ib = 0; ib < NUMCELLS; ib ++)
00528                         {
00529                                 if(ib == model + 1) continue;
00530                                 if(fRatio > (LLMatrix[iq][model+1] - LLMatrix[iq][ib]))
00531                                 {
00532                                         fRatio = LLMatrix[iq][model+1] - LLMatrix[iq][ib];
00533                                 }
00534                         }
00535                         LLRatioVector[iq] = fRatio;
00536                 }
00537                 PvalModelVector[model+1].first = GetPValue(LLRatioVector);
00538                 PvalModelVector[model+1].second = model;
00539         }
00540 
00541         // to make it backward compatible, swap AB and BB to keep the original order for breaking ties 
00542         pair<float,int> temp = PvalModelVector[2];
00543         PvalModelVector[2] = PvalModelVector[3];
00544         PvalModelVector[3] = temp;
00545 
00546         // SNP level aggregation, the best is the one with the smallest p-value
00547         sort(PvalModelVector.begin(), PvalModelVector.end(), PairLess());
00548 
00549         // the results, p-value first, genotype call second
00550         results.first = round(PvalModelVector[0].first, 6);
00551         results.second = PvalModelVector[0].second;
00552 
00553         return true;
00554 }
